title: Hyderabadi Chicken Biryani
ingredients: 500g chicken (marinated in yogurt, chili, and biryani masala)
Whole spices (bay leaf, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom)
Saffron milk + mint + coriander for layering
instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes, then cook until 70% done.
Fry onions until golden brown and set aside.
Cook marinated chicken until almost done.
In a pot, layer rice and chicken alternately.
Top with saffron milk, fried onions, mint, and coriander.
Seal with lid and cook on low flame for 20 minutes (dum).

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Amma üíõ

title: Pesarattu (Green Gram Dosa)
instructions: Soak green gram overnight or for 6 hours.
Grind with ginger, green chilies, and salt to a smooth batter.
Heat a tawa, spread batter into thin dosa shape.
Roast both sides with a little oil until golden brown.
Serve hot with ginger chutney.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Nanna ü´∂

title: Gongura Pachadi (Sorrel Leaves Chutney)
instructions: Wash and clean gongura leaves thoroughly.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
Add dried red chilies and garlic, saut√© until fragrant.
Add gongura leaves and cook until they wilt completely.
Add tamarind pulp, salt, and turmeric powder.
Cook for 5-7 minutes until oil separates. Cool and grind to paste.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Telugu Kitchen Traditions

title: Andhra Chicken Curry
instructions: Marinate chicken with turmeric, salt, and half the ginger-garlic paste for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, add onions and saut√© until golden brown.
Add remaining ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
Add tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add all spice powders and cook until oil separates.
Add marinated chicken and cook covered until tender.
Garnish with curry leaves and coriander leaves.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Andhra Spice Masters

title: Rava Dosa (Semolina Crepes)
instructions: Mix semolina, rice flour, and all-purpose flour in a bowl.
Add yogurt and mix well, then add water to make thin batter.
Add cumin seeds, black pepper, green chilies, and ginger.
Add curry leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well.
Let batter rest for 15-20 minutes.
Heat tawa, pour batter in circular motion to make thin dosas.
Cook until crispy and golden brown on both sides.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Breakfast Specialists

title: Pulihora (Tamarind Rice)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
Add dried red chilies, peanuts, and cashews. Roast until golden.
Add curry leaves and tamarind pulp.
Add turmeric powder and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked rice and mix gently until well combined.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on low heat. Serve warm.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Telugu Festival Kitchen

title: Coconut Chutney
ingredients: For tempering: 1 tsp oil, mustard seeds, curry leaves, dried red chili
instructions: Grind coconut, roasted chana dal, green chilies, ginger, and cumin seeds.
Add salt and water to make smooth paste.
Heat oil for tempering, add mustard seeds.
Add curry leaves and dried red chili.
Pour tempering over chutney and mix well.
Serve with dosas, idlis, or rice.
Store in refrigerator for up to 2 days.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Chutney Masters

title: Bisi Bele Bath (Spicy Rice & Lentils)
instructions: Cook rice and toor dal together until soft.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Add cashews and peanuts, roast until golden.
Add vegetables and cook until tender.
Add bisi bele bath powder and tamarind pulp.
Add cooked rice-dal mixture and mix well.
Cook for 10-15 minutes on low heat. Serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Karnataka Kitchen Traditions

title: Masala Dosa
ingredients: For dosa batter: 2 cups rice, 1 cup urad dal, salt
For potato masala: 3 potatoes, 1 onion, 2 green chilies, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric, salt
instructions: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 6 hours.
Grind separately, mix together, add salt, and ferment overnight.
Boil potatoes, peel and mash them.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.
Add onions, saut√© until golden, add turmeric and salt.
Add mashed potatoes and mix well.
Make thin dosas, add potato masala, fold, and serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Dosa Masters

title: Gutti Vankaya (Stuffed Brinjal Curry)
instructions: Make cross cuts in brinjals without separating them.
Grind peanuts, sesame seeds, and coconut to coarse powder.
Mix ground powder with all spice powders and salt.
Stuff this mixture into the brinjals.
Heat oil in a pan, add curry leaves.
Add stuffed brinjals and cook covered until tender.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Andhra Vegetable Specialists

title: Rasam (South Indian Hotel Style)
ingredients: For tempering: 2 tsp oil, 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 dried red chilies, curry leaves, coriander leaves
instructions: Cook toor dal until soft and mash it well.
In a pot, add chopped tomatoes, tamarind pulp, and water.
Add rasam powder, turmeric, and salt. Boil until tomatoes are soft.
Add mashed dal and mix well. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Heat oil for tempering, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and red chilies.
Add curry leaves and pour tempering over rasam.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Hotel Masters

title: Sambar Recipe (How to Make Sambar)
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (drumstick, carrot, beans, brinjal)
For tempering: 2 tbsp oil, 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp fenugreek seeds, 2 dried red chilies, curry leaves, asafoetida
instructions: Cook toor dal until soft and mash it well.
Cook mixed vegetables until tender in a separate pot.
Add tamarind pulp, sambar powder, turmeric, and salt to vegetables.
Add mashed dal and mix well. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Heat oil for tempering, add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and red chilies.
Add curry leaves and asafoetida. Pour tempering over sambar.
Serve hot with rice, idli, or dosa.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Traditional South Indian Kitchen

title: Medu Vada Recipe (Garelu)
instructions: Soak urad dal overnight and drain water completely.
Grind dal to smooth paste without adding water.
Add cumin seeds, black pepper, green chilies, and ginger.
Add curry leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well.
Heat oil for deep frying.
Wet hands, take small portions, make hole in center, and drop in hot oil.
Fry until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Snack Specialists

title: Idli Recipe (Idli Batter Recipe with Pro Tips)
instructions: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 6 hours.
Grind urad dal with fenugreek seeds to smooth paste.
Grind rice to coarse paste.
Mix both batters, add salt, and mix well.
Let batter ferment overnight (8-12 hours) in warm place.
Grease idli plates, pour batter, and steam for 10-12 minutes.
Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Breakfast Masters

title: Ven Pongal Recipe (Khara Pongal)
instructions: Wash rice and moong dal together.
Heat ghee in pressure cooker, add cumin seeds and black pepper.
Add green chilies, ginger, and curry leaves. Saut√© for 30 seconds.
Add rice-dal mixture and water. Add salt and mix well.
Pressure cook for 3 whistles on medium flame.
Let pressure release naturally. Mix well and serve hot.
Garnish with more ghee and serve with coconut chutney.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Tamil Nadu Kitchen Traditions

title: Tomato Rice Recipe (Indian Style)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
Add curry leaves, green chilies, and sliced onions.
Saut√© until onions turn golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt.
Cook until tomatoes turn mushy and oil separates.
Add cooked rice and mix gently until well combined.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on low heat. Serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Rice Specialists

title: Coconut Rice Recipe
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add urad dal, chana dal, and dried red chilies.
Saut√© until dals turn golden brown.
Add curry leaves and grated coconut. Saut√© for 2 minutes.
Add salt and mix well.
Add cooked rice and mix gently until well combined.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on low heat. Serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Kerala Kitchen Traditions

title: Murukku Recipe (Murukulu)
instructions: Mix rice flour, urad dal flour, sesame seeds, and cumin seeds.
Add red chili powder and salt. Mix well.
Add water gradually to make smooth dough.
Heat oil for deep frying.
Use murukku press to make spiral shapes directly in hot oil.
Fry until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and cool completely before storing.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Festival Snack Masters

title: Tomato Pappu Recipe (Andhra Tomato Dal)
ingredients: For tempering: 2 tbsp oil, 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, curry leaves, garlic cloves
instructions: Cook toor dal with turmeric powder until soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
Add curry leaves, garlic cloves, and green chilies.
Add chopped onions and saut√© until golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and salt.
Cook until tomatoes turn mushy. Add cooked dal and mix well.
Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve hot with rice.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Andhra Dal Specialists

title: Pudina Chutney Recipe (Mint Chutney)
ingredients: For tempering: 1 tsp oil, mustard seeds, curry leaves
instructions: Wash mint and coriander leaves thoroughly.
Grind mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chilies, ginger, and cumin seeds.
Add lemon juice, salt, and water to make smooth paste.
Heat oil for tempering, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Pour tempering over chutney and mix well.
Serve fresh with dosas, idlis, or rice.
Store in refrigerator for up to 2 days.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Chutney Masters

title: Soft Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients: For filling: 1/2 cup unsalted butter (melted), 1 cup brown sugar, 2 tbsp ground cinnamon
For glaze: 4 oz cream cheese (softened), 1/4 cup unsalted butter (softened), 1-1.5 cups powdered sugar, 1/2 tsp vanilla, 1-2 tbsp milk
instructions: In stand mixer bowl, combine warm milk, yeast, sugar, salt, butter & eggs. Add flour.
Mix on low speed using dough hook, then increase to medium until dough pulls away from sides.
Cover and let rise until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Roll out risen dough into 12x18 inch rectangle on floured surface.
Brush melted butter all over, sprinkle brown sugar followed by cinnamon.
Roll up tightly from longer side, slice into 12 pieces, place in greased 9x13 inch tin.
Cover and let rise 30-35 minutes. Preheat oven to 325¬∞F.
Bake 25-30 minutes until lightly brown. Frost while warm and enjoy!

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Ria's Collection

title: Tea Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Grease a 9-inch loaf pan.
Sift flour and baking powder together. Set aside.
Beat eggs and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add butter and beat well. Add milk and mix.
Fold in flour mixture gradually. Add caraway seeds.
Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 45-50 minutes until golden.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to wire rack.
Slice and serve with tea or coffee.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Mrs Bava Lukose via Ria's Collection

title: Semolina Bread Loaf
instructions: Oil a 9x5 inch loaf tin and set aside.
Mix all ingredients except oil in large bowl to form soft shaggy mass.
Cover and rest for 20-25 minutes.
Add 1 tbsp oil and knead until windowpane test (15-20 min by hand, 5-6 min in mixer).
Let dough rest in covered, oiled container until doubled in size.
Knock back dough, roll into rectangle, roll up and place in prepared tin.
Cover and let rise until doubled (about 30 minutes).
Brush top with ghee, bake at 200¬∞C/400¬∞F for 30-35 minutes until golden.
Brush more ghee over baked loaf, cool on wire rack completely.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Ria's Collection

title: Kuttanadan Duck Roast
instructions: Marinate duck with ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, and salt.
Let marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Heat oil in a large pan, add sliced onions and saut√© until golden.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add marinated duck and cook covered until tender.
Add curry leaves and coconut milk if using.
Cook until duck is fully done and gravy thickens.
Serve hot with rice or bread.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Ria's Collection

title: Kerala Fish Curry
instructions: Clean fish pieces and marinate with turmeric and salt.
Heat coconut oil, add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and red chilies.
Add curry leaves and saut√© until fragrant.
Add red chili powder, coriander powder, and turmeric. Saut√© briefly.
Add coconut milk and tamarind pulp. Bring to boil.
Add fish pieces and cook covered until fish is done.
Adjust salt and spices. Serve hot with rice.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Kerala Kitchen via Ria's Collection

title: Malabar Parotta
instructions: Mix flour, salt, sugar, egg, and oil in a bowl.
Add water gradually to make soft dough. Knead well.
Divide into small balls, brush with oil, and rest for 30 minutes.
Roll each ball into thin circle, brush with oil, and fold into layers.
Roll again into thin circle. Heat tawa.
Cook parotta on both sides with oil until golden and crispy.
Serve hot with curry or chutney.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Malabar Kitchen via Ria's Collection

title: Kerala Prawns Curry
instructions: Clean prawns and marinate with turmeric and salt.
Heat coconut oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add green chilies and saut√© briefly.
Add red chili powder and turmeric. Saut√© for 30 seconds.
Add coconut milk and tamarind pulp. Bring to boil.
Add prawns and cook until prawns are done.
Adjust salt. Serve hot with rice.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Coastal Kerala Kitchen via Ria's Collection

title: Kerala Chicken Stew
instructions: Heat coconut oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add sliced onions, green chilies, ginger, and garlic.
Saut√© until onions turn translucent.
Add chicken pieces and turmeric powder. Cook until chicken changes color.
Add coconut milk and bring to boil.
Add potatoes if using. Cook until chicken and potatoes are tender.
Adjust salt. Serve hot with appam or bread.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Kerala Comfort Kitchen via Ria's Collection

title: Kerala Appam
instructions: Soak raw rice for 4-6 hours. Drain and grind with cooked rice and coconut.
Mix yeast with sugar and warm water. Let it froth.
Add yeast mixture to ground batter. Add salt and mix well.
Let batter ferment overnight (8-12 hours).
Heat appam pan, pour batter in center, swirl to spread.
Cover and cook until edges are crispy and center is soft.
Serve hot with stew or curry.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Traditional Kerala Kitchen via Ria's Collection

title: ‡∞™‡±Ü‡∞∏‡∞∞‡∞ü‡±ç‡∞ü‡±Å (Pesarattu)
instructions: Soak green gram overnight or for 6 hours.
Grind with ginger, green chilies, and salt to a smooth batter.
Heat a tawa, spread batter into thin dosa shape.
Roast both sides with a little oil until golden brown.
Serve hot with ginger chutney.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Telugu Kitchen Traditions
